definitions: a short cylindrical "pin" or "dowel" of wood or metal used for fastening, spacing, or holding things
a "hook" or "knob" on which to hang things
a "marker" or "indicator" used in certain games or instruments
a "degree" or "level" in a scale, often referring to a person's status or condition
examples: He hung his coat on the peg.
The peg in the game board marked his position.
He's a peg above me in the company.
That was the peg on which he hung his argument.
